title: Set Up Equation For Problem
text: We know that the initial velocity $$v=220$$ and the desire height is 400. We can set up the equation as $$-16t^2+220t=400$$.

title: Solve For Unknown Using Quadratic Formula
Solve For Unknown Using Quadratic Formula
text: $$-16t^2+220t=400$$ Solve for t using the quadratic formula. Round your answer to the nearest hundredth. If there is more than one answer, please enter it as (a,b) where $$a<b$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Since both 2.16 and 11.59 are positive, they are valid answer for the problem. Therefore, at 2.16 second and 11.59 second, the height of the arrow will be 400 feet.
